abstract: HSBC Alternative Investments has become the single largest casualty of the redemptions crisis in the hedge fund industry, The Financial Times reported, with clients withdrawing $4 billion.
snippet: HSBC Alternative Investments has become the single largest casualty of the redemptions crisis in the hedge fund industry, The Financial Times reported, with clients withdrawing $4 billion.
lead_paragraph: HSBC Alternative Investments has become, in absolute terms, the single largest casualty of the redemptions crisis in the hedge fund industry, The Financial Times reported. The private bank saw clients withdraw more than $4 billion, or 52 percent, from its portfolios in the first half of the year.

headline.main: HSBC Fund of Funds Sees $4 Billion in Withdrawals
